```{=html}
           <div class="popup_descr">The key aim of Dr Bieschke’s research is to understand the central problem in the prion mechanism; what is the change in shape that distinguishes normal prion protein PrPC from its rogue form PrPSc and how does it come about? Specifically, his lab explores the structural causes are for becoming a prion, what the common drivers are for prion replication, what are the mechanistic pathways for prion protein misfolding and self-assembly, and whether the same principles underlie other diseases, both inside the central nervous system and in the rest of the body.<br>His lab combines biophysical techniques with nanoscopic imaging to study the structure, folding and dynamics of prions, both in isolation and with likely binding partners, in order to develop new strategies against prion diseases. He previously pursued his research at the Max-Planck-Institute for Biophysical Chemistry, LMU Munich, The Scripps Research Institute, the Max-Delbrück Center for Molecular Medicine and Washington University in St Louis. Since 2018, Dr Bieschke serves as Associate Professor at the Faculty of Brain Sciences of UCL as well as MRC Investigator and Program Lead at the MRC Prion Unit at UCL.</div>
```

```{=html}
<script>
  // Get all elements with class="image-description" (outside the popups) and attach the click event
  var descriptions = document.getElementsByClassName("image-description");
  for (let i = 0; i < descriptions.length; i++) {
    descriptions[i].onclick = function() {
      // Open the corresponding popup
      var popup = document.getElementById("popup" + (i + 1));
      popup.style.display = "block";
    }
  }

  // Get all elements with class="close" and attach the click event
  var closes = document.getElementsByClassName("close");
  for (let i = 0; i < closes.length; i++) {
    closes[i].onclick = function() {
      // Close the corresponding popup
      var popup = document.getElementById("popup" + (i + 1));
      popup.style.display = "none";
    }
  }
  
  // Get all elements with class="popup-background" and attach the click event
  var backgrounds = document.getElementsByClassName("popup-background");
  for (let i = 0; i < backgrounds.length; i++) {
    backgrounds[i].onclick = function() {
      // Close the corresponding popup
      var popup = document.getElementById("popup" + (i + 1));
      popup.style.display = "none";
    }
  }
  // Move all popups to the body element
  var popups = Array.from(document.getElementsByClassName("popup"));
  for (var i = 0; i < popups.length; i++) {
    document.body.appendChild(popups[i]);
  }

  // When the user clicks anywhere outside of a popup, close it
  window.onclick = function(event) {
    if (event.target.className == "popup") {
      event.target.style.display = "none";
    }
  }
</script>
```
